column4: where can I find my .login script? I got help with a problem I had on the ub
where can I find my .login script? I got help with a problem I had on the ubuntu forums but I cant figure out where my .login script is. *
(sorry for sending the message to fas)
fast*
:D
no one?
!.login
!login
!script
What do you mean by .login script? :)
Look at the URL I wrote. The last comment :)
your own . files are usually at ~/  (under your home directory)
A summary would have worked. That'd be .bashrc but better place for that is under ./kde/Autostart
yeah I know. However I thought I was suppose to have my own login script that would runt automaticly at boot up? But I couldn't find one looking like a login script
xmodmap does you nada outside x!
thanks :)
I'm only under x while inside the computer so I guess I'm in the clear?
hmm, lost me there. Or are you trying to add some other command than xmodmap?
And oops, sorry, I got confused between kubuntu and ubuntu again. I should prolly leave this channel... happens too often to me
I'm suppose to write a line like this " xmodmap ~/.xmodmap-`uname -n " in my .login file :)
what danfg said is better advice than mine
No worries... its better to help even if we're not always right. Thank you anyway. :)
I'm having a major brainlag day in general today...
then we're two then :D
